definition: to model/to mold/(fig.) to create (a character, a market, an image etc)/(literature) to portray (in words)
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops

sentences.english: Types existed in personage's image-building in the novels of the Ming and Qing Dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 明清講史小說在人物形象塑造上存在着類型化傾向。

sentences.english: Shape the nail, using a file or emery board .
sentences.chinese: 塑造釘子，使用一個文件或金剛砂董事會。

sentences.english: The sculptor figured the girl in clay.
sentences.chinese: 雕塑家用粘土塑造了這個女孩子的形象。

sentences.english: Families play an important role in moulding children’s character.
sentences.chinese: 家庭在塑造孩子的性格方面起着重要作用。

sentences.english: The Altamira Cave consists of a series of rooms and passages shaped like anS.
sentences.chinese: 阿爾塔米拉洞包括的一系列房間和塑造象像S型。

sentences.english: Victorians saw a cleft palate as a defect that built character.
sentences.chinese: 維多利亞時代將齶裂視爲塑造特徵的缺陷。

sentences.english: He successfully portrayed the image of hero in this movie.
sentences.chinese: 他在這部電影中成功地塑造了英雄形象。

sentences.english: Have you ever seen the Thriller image when he was made up?
sentences.chinese: 你以前見過他在歌曲毛骨悚然中塑造的形象嗎？

sentences.english: This paradigm shift, he says, has become pivitol in shaping his brand.
sentences.chinese: 他表示，這一轉變成爲塑造其品牌的關鍵。

sentences.english: That man has reversed Genesis- man has make God to his image and likeness.
sentences.chinese: 人卻本末倒置，以自己的形像塑造天主。

sentences.english: Bidding for the Olympic Games is, in a way, an image-creating undertaking.
sentences.chinese: 申辦奧運會從某種角度上說是一個塑造形象的工程。

sentences.english: During the development of the GIRSUN it pay more attention to brand image.
sentences.chinese: 格尚在發展的歷程中，更加註重品牌形象的塑造。

sentences.english: You are expected to mold and shape it into a realistic schedule.
sentences.chinese: 您需要通過塑造和定型將它變成實際的時間表。

sentences.english: He talks about how we can hold up a mirror to nature.
sentences.chinese: 他談到如何塑造一面能夠反映自然的鏡子。

sentences.english: Next elaborated has molded girl-student healthy personality the realitybasis.
sentences.chinese: 其次論述了塑造女生健全人格的現實依據。

sentences.english: Under a different name, I can re-invent myself.
sentences.chinese: 用不同一個名字，我可以重新塑造自我。

definition: role/character in a novel/persona/also pr. [jiao3 se4]
to enter deeply into people's hearts/to have a real impact on the people (idiom)
(of a story etc) to unfold/to play out/to develop (a technique etc)/to enact/(logic) to deduce/to infer
person/character (in a play, novel etc)/protagonist/CL:個|个[ge4]
to interpret/to comment and explain/to annotate/to perform (i.e. interpret a theatrical role)/to decode/interpretation/annotation
to bring up/to train/to contribute to/achievements (usually of young people)
to come out/to emerge/to reveal/to display
to create/to build/to develop/to forge (of metal)
to construct (often sth abstract, such as good relations)/to set up/to develop/construction (abstract)/architecture
